page.title: 07Hungerford Common.
page.content: Hungerford Common is the only Common around for miles.It covers an area of about 19 acres.It has about 160 cows on it in the summer months. Hungerford Common is also well known for picnicing.There are a number of disused gravel pits. There are also Commoners' Rights which allow you to put cattle on the Common if you live in special houses down the High street.These allow you to put 2 to 4 cows on the Common also to fish in the Kennet and Avon canal.Commoners rights were given to Hungerford in the 13th century by John'O'Gaunt.The Common is maintained by the trustees of the Town and Manor of Hungerford which was set up in 1907 and the grass is kept under control by the cows. Hungerford Common gives great pleasure to many people and their dogs.
